title: Jesus Christ, second coming of
comment: Jesus Christ will return visibly and in glory at the end of history to raise the dead, judge the world, destroy all evil and opposition to God and consummate his kingdom. Believers are encouraged to be prepared for his return, waiting with eagerness and joy.

children.title: By the angels at Jesus Christ's ascension
NT terms for the second coming
``Parousia''
children.precomment: Meaning literally ``presence'' or ``coming'', the term was used in the NT world of a royal visit:

children.title: ``Apocalypsis''
children.precomment: Meaning literally ``unveiling'', ``apocalypsis'' suggests that the second coming will make visible that which is already true of Jesus Christ but presently hidden from human sight:

children.title: ``Epiphaneia''
children.precomment: Meaning literally ``appearing'' or ``manifestation'', the term suggests coming out into view from a hidden background:

children.title: Events that will precede the second coming
The universal preaching of the gospel

primaryrefs.comment: The antichrist is a name given to the one who will lead opposition to God's kingdom.  It appears to refer to an individual but may denote a corporate movement.

children.title: The appearance of false Christs and false prophets
The timing of the second coming

primaryrefs.comment: Part of a parable concerning the coming of Jesus Christ who is represented by the bridegroom.

children.title: The manner of the second coming
With the sound of a trumpet
The purpose of the second coming
To separate the wicked from the righteous
To destroy all evil and opposition to God's kingdom
To transform the saints into his likeness
To restore and renew all things
Reactions at Jesus Christ's second coming
Present implications of the second coming for believers
They must always be watchful and ready
They must eagerly expect his coming
They must endure suffering with patient endurance
It is an incentive to holiness
It is an incentive to mission
